intro: Styrax japonicus var. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered Japanese styrax, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its fragrant, white, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green, providing an attractive appearance throughout the growing season. It prefers partial shade to full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for garden cultivation. The bark is smooth and reddish-brown, adding visual interest in winter when the plant is dormant.
